ratings.comment: Before I took spanish 226 I had a genuine love for Spanish. But now I absolutely dread the class and speaking the language because Professor Ananth makes me feel very insecure to speak spanish in class. She is very hard on her students and will never cut you a break even if you do one assignment wrong out of fifty.

Priya was one of the more difficult TAs for 226 from what I heard. Her expectations were very high for her students. There were so many assignments and a lot of them were group projects. She gives good feedback on all written work, but is very tough. I definitely improved my writing skills, but I did not look forward to class with her.

Priya wasn't necessarily a bad teacher, but picked favorites the first week of class and really stuck to them, so get on her good side right away. Also never revealed one detail about her personal life but rather stuck to a strict minute-by-minute schedule every class period. Tough grader. Always yelled at the class for doing sloppy work.
She is one of the best Spanish teachers I have ever had. It wasn't until the third or fourth week that I realized that she is a TA and not a full fledged professor because she is just that amazing.
Priya was a good prof. 226 is hard in general, but she does a good job of covering material. BEWARE, practice tests are always easier than actual tests.
Extremely helpful, clear, and bright. I would highly recommend trying to get her as a TA if you could.
Priya is phenomenal. She is very clear, helpful, and a great teacher.

Priya was very helpful and attentive to her students. She was always well prepared for class with lots of practice and things to do for the whole time. Before exams, we would review and she would drop useful hints of how the questions would be on the exam. Excellent instructor!

Priya was very helpful and understanding throughout the course.  I can honestly say my speaking has improved and that I have learned more in one semester with Priya than any other year in high school.  I would definitely recommend this TA.
Shes is a good professor. She speaks very clear spanish and is flexible and willing to help.

She is a great instructor- I will choose her out of other TAs if I get the choice again. She is a good instructor if you really want to learn Spanish. She pushes students to really use their knowledge which is essential if you want to learn a language. She gives you the base knowledge to succeed in the class and is very clear in her expectations.

Very good teacher in a small class setting (20 students). Definitely knows what she teaches, and loves everything about it. Very helpful with any students who struggle. Highly recommend taking a Spanish class with her.
